content: or I/O expansion frames  Any IBM z14 (M/T 3906) to IBM z16 A01: – Feature conversion of installed zAAPs to zIIPs (default) or another processor type – For installed On-Demand Records, change temporary zAAPs to zIIPs (stage the record)  Any IBM z15 (M/T 8561) - IBM z16 A01  IBM z16 (M/T 3931) - IBM z16 A01: – Model to model MAXxx upgrades cannot be performed if I/O drawers are populating the CPC drawer positions. – Supported model upgrade paths are listed in Table 2-12. Table 2-12 Supported model MAXxx upgrade paths Max39 Max82 Max125 Max168 Max200 Max39 N Y Y N N Max82 N N Y N N Max125 N N N N N Max168 N N N N N Max200 N N N N N 58 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide 2.8.2 Model capacity identifier To recognize how many PUs are characterized as CPs, the Store System Information (STSI) instruction returns a Model Capacity Identifier (MCI). The MCI determines the number and speed of characterized CPs. Characterization of a PU as an IFL, ICF, or zIIP is not reflected in the output of the
